channel.title: Do the following exist in the cache (317)?
channel.description: Are NPC animations and definitions in the cache? I see that object definitions do, but I also see that item definitions are loaded from a bin file, when I know those are stored in the cache. I'm using the cache that comes with Hyperion if that helps.

item.title: Do the following exist in the cache (317)?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I see, thank you.

Read full topic
item.source: Do the following exist in the cache (317)?

item.title: Do the following exist in the cache (317)?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:5, topic:463057”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=566348.msg4118513#msg4118513 date=1349389825]
Yes, all things relating to the gameworld exist in the cache. The reason they (should) exist on the server-side as well is for integrity and validation. Otherwise, people could edit the cache, and have a severe impact on the gameplay (edit the world layout, drop items, etc).

Although, the cache only has enough information to be able to render, and interact with the gameworld. An example is the health of npcs. The client doesn’t need to know the health of an npc, in order to render it for the player.
[/quote]
I see, Hyperion does come with JAGGRAB and Ondemand, so are there any threats I need to be wary about with a server-side cache?[/quote]

Not really. As long as all clients that connect to your server, make use of those services, then the cache the client uses will always be set by the server. Because of that, if there are any client-side changes (modified packets, hardcoded items/npcs) things might begin to look weird (ie. replacing the bronze helm with a party hat client-side). This will only affect the person with the modified client, so there’s no threat.

Read full topic
item.source: Do the following exist in the cache (317)?

Otherwise, people could edit the cache, and have a severe impact on the gameplay (edit the world layout, drop items, etc).

Although, the cache only has enough information to be able to render, and interact with the gameworld. An example is the health of npcs. The client doesn’t need to know the health of an npc, in order to render it for the player.[/quote]

item.title: Do the following exist in the cache (317)?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yes, all things relating to the gameworld exist in the cache. The reason they (should) exist on the server-side as well is for integrity and validation. Otherwise, people could edit the cache, and have a severe impact on the gameplay (edit the world layout, drop items, etc).

Although, the cache only has enough information to be able to render, and interact with the gameworld. An example is the health of npcs. The client doesn’t need to know the health of an npc, in order to render it for the player.
